law.catch_line: Chief Justice; Appointment Of Executive Secretary And Staff; Expenditures
law.text: [ Text of section effective until July 1, 2012. For text effective July 1, 2012, see below.] The chief justice shall be provided with suitable offices. He may, subject to appropriation, appoint an executive secretary and such clerks, assistants or other personnel as he may require and may make such other expenditures for printing, transportation of papers and documents and for other expenses as are incidental to his duties. He may remove said executive secretary at his pleasure and define his duties. Chapter 217: Provision of suitable offices [ Text of section as amended by 2011, 93, Sec. 76 effective July 1, 2012. See 2011, 93, Sec. 137. For text effective until July 1, 2012, see above.] The chief justice and deputy court administrator shall be provided with suitable offices.
